markdownRemark.html:
My colleague Sungmin and I have been collaborating on using language models ðŸ¤– to solve the automated fault localization. Our approach, named AutoFL, involves having the language model autonomously extract information during debugging, similar to how human developers rely on diverse sources. Our initial evaluation has yielded promising results: when provided with a single failing test and basic functions, AutoFL outperforms Spectrum-Based Fault Localization (SBFL), in terms of the number of perfect predictions.

Feel free to check out our preprint for more details (https://arxiv.org/abs/2308.05487), and donâ€™t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

frontmatter.title: [ICSE'23] Fonte: Finding Bug Inducing Commits from Failures
